game

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Canvas
        • game.Game
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class Game
extends java.awt.Canvas
implements java.lang.Runnable
    The Game class contains methods to communicate with the server; It contains other classes and methods that contain the core-game loop, and will render the level that players will play on. Essentially this will hold everything to construct the game with given information to get the game started for all players.
    Author:
    Clayton Nida
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Game.GameServerListener
      GameServerListener is used to scan the Input Stream from the server and deal send it to the correct methods with Game.
      class  Game.GameServerListenerLocation
      Another listener, that will listen to the servers commands through an Input Stream and deal with them accordingly.
      class  Game.latencyChecker
      the latencyChecker class will be it's own Thread that will be used to ping the server every second to get the response time.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game(java.lang.String level,
            int stock,
            int seconds,
            java.lang.String p1Username,
            java.lang.String p2Username,
            java.lang.String p3Username,
            java.lang.String p4Username,
            java.lang.String p1Character,
            java.lang.String p2Character,
            java.lang.String p3Character,
            java.lang.String p4Character,
            java.lang.String nameOfUser)
     throws com.ivan.xinput.exceptions.XInputNotLoadedException
        This is the constructor for the Game. This class is constructed after a lobby is made and passed all the correct information. Once done, the constructor will then take this information and populate the game's level, players, game time, stock (lives) of each player, and the name of the current user.
        Parameters:
        level - The level that will be loaded and played on.
        stock - The number of lives that each player will start with.
        seconds - The amount of time (in seconds) that the game will last. This number will be used in minutes.
        p1Username - Player one's user name.
        p2Username - Player two's user name.
        p3Username - Player three's user name.
        p4Username - Player four's user name.
        p1Character - The in-game character that Player one will be controlling.
        p2Character - The in-game character that Player two will be controlling.
        p3Character - The in-game character that Player three will be controlling.
        p4Character - The in-game character that Player four will be controlling.
        nameOfUser - Name of current (this) user.
        Throws:
        com.ivan.xinput.exceptions.XInputNotLoadedException - And exception thrown in-case a controller isn't detected or the wrong type of controller is being used.

    • Method Detail

      • loadLevel

        private void loadLevel(java.lang.String level)
        This is the method that is passed the String level. It will use the Sprite class to load the correct images based on the level. It will also load the images of each player.
        Parameters:
        level -

      • scale

        public static int scale(int x)
        This method will take a number and scale it to the correct number of pixels. (1080)
        Parameters:
        x - The number that needs to be scaled to 1080 pixels.
        Returns:
        The correct number scaled to match 1080 pixels.

      • sync

        private void sync()
        The sync method is used to send the true (scaled) locations of all players, where it will then be sent to all clients. This is is done to ensure that the locations of all players is the same on all clients.

      • start

        public void start()
        This method is a part of the runnable methods.
        See Also:
        Runnable

      • stop

        public void stop()
        This method is a part of the runnable methods.
        See Also:
        Runnable

      • handleLoc

        public void handleLoc(java.lang.String cmd,
                      java.lang.String s)
        This will handle the information sent from the server through GameServerListenerLocation. It will exclusivly deal with the locations of all players.
        Parameters:
        cmd - The first part of the string that is sent from the server. This is always the command and helps to determine what to do with it.
        s - The remaining portion of the string sent from the server. This is typically information that will be used by the command.

      • handleMoves

        public void handleMoves(java.lang.String cmd,
                        java.lang.String s)
        This will handle the information sent from the server through GameServerListener. It will deal with assigning player numbers, as-well-as, dealing with the inputs of each player and what to do with them.
        Parameters:
        cmd - The first part of the string that is sent from the server. This is always the command and helps to determine what to do with it.
        s - The remaining portion of the string sent from the server. This is typically information that will be used by the command.

      • run

        public void run()
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • tick

        private void tick()
        This will call the tick() method in the Handler class
        See Also:
        Handler.java

      • render

        private void render()
        This is the method that will be called in the main game-loop. It will take all the images that were loaded in the constructor and loadLevel method and render them while the game is being played.

      • timer

        public int timer(int seconds)
        This is the method that takes the number of seconds from the Game constructor and will parse them and display them in the form of minutes. It will count down this time using the System clock.
        Parameters:
        seconds - Takes the number of seconds from the Game and will use them along with the system timer to get a count down of the number of seconds.
        Returns:
        0

      • setInterval

        private static int setInterval(java.util.Timer timer)
        This will set the time and count down the correct time in seconds.
        Parameters:
        timer -
        Returns:
        interval This is the correct time based on whether or not a second has passed.

      • clamp

        public static int clamp(int var,
                        int min,
                        int max)
        This method will 'clamp' the boundaries of the game off. Meaning that if a player is trying to move to a location, clamp will change the boundaries of the game so that they cannot move there.
        Parameters:
        var - The variable that is currently being used.
        min - The minimum value that will be allowed.
        max - The maximum value that will be allowed.
        Returns:
        The variable based on the min/max value.
